title: Airbnb reports continued deceleration in nights and experiences booked
description: Airbnb said that nights and experiences booked grew 11%, missing estimates. But the number improved in June in comparison with April, the company said.

title: Amazon's online advertising unit just brought in over $10 billion in the second quarter
description: Amazon's online advertising business has become lucrative for the online retailer.

title: An airplane pilot went viral for scolding his passengers—Harvard expert says it's great leadership: 'Bravo'
description: An American Airlines pilot who scolded passengers in a recent viral video displayed top-notch leadership skills, says a Harvard University expert. Here's why.

title: Secondhand luxury watch prices slump to near two-year low after a pandemic run
description: Experts had warned that a bubble could burst along with cryptocurrency and other trendy pandemic booms. But the recent declines appear to mark a stabilization.

title: Microsoft is touting the size and growth rate of its Salesforce rival Dynamics
description: Dynamics grew faster than almost all other parts of Microsoft in the latest fiscal year, and the company is now giving investors more clarity on its size.

title: Bank of England governor says cautious approach needed after ‘unwelcome surprises’ in inflation data
description: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said Thursday that the central bank remains cautious in its battle to tame inflation.

title: Qualcomm stock drops 10% as phone chip sales dive
description: The chipmaker beat on the top line but reported weaker-than-expected revenue and upcoming guidance, following a sharp downturn in income.

title: Amazon set to report second-quarter earnings after the bell
description: Amazon investors will be focused on cloud revenue growth, retail margins and commentary around artificial intelligence in the company's earnings report.

title: A psychologist shares the 6 toxic traits of 'highly narcissistic' parents—and how to deal with them
description: Dr. Ramani Durvasula has spent her career studying narcissists. Here are the most common traits she sees in highly narcissistic parents—and how to deal with them.

title: Saudi Arabia to extend voluntary 1 million barrel per day crude oil production cut into September
description: Heavyweight Oil producer Saudi Arabia will extend a 1 million barrel per day crude oil output cut into September, the state-owned Saudi Press Agency said.

title: Unprecedented Canada wildfires obliterate previous annual pollution record in just seven months
description: Astonished climate scientists have warned that the unprecedented nature of what's happening in Canada is a harbinger of what's still to come.

title: China's the top importer of Ukrainian grain, and could save the Black Sea deal
description: Beijing, one of Moscow's most strategic allies, was the top recipient of Ukrainian agricultural products under the Black Sea Grain Initiative.

title: How layoffs and A.I. are impacting tech workers
description: After years of unstoppable growth, big tech’s pandemic bubble burst forcing tech companies to trim their rosters

title: Chinese tech giant Alibaba challenges Meta with open-sourced A.I. model launch
description: In April, Alibaba launched its large language model (LLM) called Tongyi Qianwen as it looks to get in on generative AI.

title: Americans are going abroad in droves — at the expense of domestic travel
description: The shift overseas is driving up international airfares and room rates, while domestic growth lags.

title: Bank of England hikes rates by quarter percentage point in split vote
description: The Bank of England on Thursday raised its main interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, a 14th consecutive hike as policymakers strive to rein in inflation.

title: Watch Governor Andrew Bailey speak after the Bank of England's rate hike
description: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey is speaking at a press conference following the U.K. central bank's latest monetary policy decision.

title: Tom Brady takes minority stake in second-tier English soccer club Birmingham City
description: Seven-time Super Bowl champion Tom Brady has become a minority owner of English soccer club Birmingham City.

title: Warren Buffett says he’s not worried about Fitch’s U.S. downgrade
description: Warren Buffett shrugged off Fitch's U.S. downgrade, noting it doesn't change what his conglomerate, Berkshire Hathaway, is doing at the moment.

title: The Fitch U.S. ratings cut is here to stay, says analyst who worked on the S&P downgrade in 2011
description: "It does not take a grand sovereign and analytics genius to understand that the fiscal profile of the U.S. is much worse than it has been," said Elliot Hentov.

title: Bud Light owner AB InBev beats forecasts in quarter dominated by boycott
description: Core profit rose 5% year-on-year, smashing expectations despite a boycott that led to a sharp fall in sales of its bestselling Bud Light beer.

title: AMD says India is a key market for keeping up with the growing demand for high-tech chips
description: India is an important market for AMD to stay pace with the growing demand for its products, the firm's CTO told CNBC on Thursday.

title: Nintendo profit surges 52% on success of new Zelda game and Super Mario movie
description: Nintendo's June quarter revenue was boosted by the success of the "Super Mario Bros. Movie" and the the popularity of its latest Zelda game for the Switch.

title: Societe Generale returns to profit, but comes under pressure in its home market
description: The bank's net income of 900 million euros ($983.6 million) was more than analysts expected, and a lot higher than the second quarter of 2022.

title: Bill Ackman says he's shorting 30-year Treasury bills, and yields could hit 5.5% 'soon'
description: Billionaire investor Bill Ackman says bond market may reprice the long end of the curve "in a matter of weeks."

title: Rice markets could face further turmoil as Thailand urges farmers to plant less rice
description: Thailand, the world's second largest exporter of rice, is encouraging its farmers to plant less of the crop in order to save water amid low rainfall.

title: Geopolitical risks are a top global threat to businesses, survey finds
description: "Geopolitical tensions are now the main focus of concern, both in the near term and the medium term," the survey said.

title: Food delivery apps Grab and Foodpanda expand into dine-in services as explosive growth stalls
description: Food delivery apps Grab and Foodpanda are offering dine-in features as consumers resume their normal daily routines and go out and dine in more frequently.

title: Burned by the European heat, travelers are seeking new destinations this summer
description: Summer travel interest is shifting as European travelers seek cooler weather in parts of Scandinavia, Scotland, Latvia, Estonia and northern Spain.

title: With record youth unemployment, China’s jobs market is getting tougher for new graduates to crack
description: Most young people are ultimately getting jobs, but ones that might not pay the best or match their area of study, according to CNBC interviews.
